channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sen Warner blasts Trump admin for excluding Democrats from briefings on boat strikes: 'Deeply troubling'
item.description: Sen. Mark Warner, D-Va., slammed the Trump administration for excluding Democrats from briefings on strikes targeting alleged drug boats, calling the ...

item.title: Yes, Test Our Nukes
item.description: It would represent an advance for the U.S. nuclear deterrent and a victory of common sense over superstition.

item.title: Trump’s Cease-Fire with China
item.description: It was probably the best that could be expected from the bad options.

item.title: The government shutdown won’t be completely recouped—and it could cost the economy up to $14 billion, estimates say
item.description: The report says lost goods and services from furloughed workers’ downtime won’t be regained once the government reopens.

item.title: Barry’s ‘cofounder’ unwinds at his own gym—but even he admits balance is elusive: ‘Many days I have to wake up and choose who I’m going to disappoint’

item.title: We Need a President to Make Congress Great Again
item.description: So long as the congressional parties are just pawns or enemies of the president, only a president can restore Congress.

item.title: ‘Conservative’ Pollster Shills For Health Insurance Companies With Sloppy Pro-Obamacare Talking Points
item.description: The arguments for extending the enhanced Obamacare subsidies are not just biased but contradictory, almost to the point of incoherence.

item.title: Companies are trying to do too much with AI, says IT CEO: ‘Pick one or two domains and go end to end’
item.description: The key extracting ROI from gen AI projects is to choose your lane—and stay there.

item.title: The U.S. Conference Of Catholic Bishops Needs To Stop Apologizing For Islam
item.description: Islam’s inherent disdain for non-Muslims must not intrude on the pieties of interfaith harmony, according to the USCCB.

item.title: This Halloween, Treat Yourself to a Neglected Horror Masterpiece
item.description: The Empty Man is the rarest of films in the genre — one whose horror comes from its ideas, not jump scares.

item.title: Since ChatGPT launched, job openings have plunged 30% while the stock market has surged 70%—but one economist says the true culprit isn’t AI
item.description: It's been called "the scariest chart in the world."

item.title: Why Male Teachers Left Elementary Schools And Won’t Go Back
item.description: Men were driven out by the increasing feminization of schools, producing a vicious cycle of female-dominated schools.

item.title: Hegseth, in talks with Chinese counterpart, says US will 'stoutly defend' interests in Indo-Pacific
item.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told his Chinese counterpart the U.S. will “stoutly defend" its Indo-Pacific interests during talks in Malaysia.

item.title: Virginians Now Know Exactly Who Jay Jones Is
item.description: Every so often, a reporter uncovers information that pierces a candidate’s consultant-spun veil and exposes their true character.

item.title: Democrats Choose Supporting LGBT Activists Over Stopping Child Rape
item.description: We have yet to find a point at which the left will actually stop its slide down the slippery slope of gay rights.

item.title: Billie Eilish calls on billionaires to give away their wealth—with Mark Zuckerberg in the room: ‘If you’re a billionaire, why are you one?’
item.description: "No hate, but yeah, give your money away, shorties,” she said at the WSJ Magazine Innovator Awards.
